TopicTitle: Question: How much power do I have over the contents of my fuel tanks?

Articles.Content:
I really appreciate how the nuclear rockets don't use LOX anymore, since it never made any sense to me. However, I now find myself wishing I could replace the LOX in some of the tanks with fuel rather than just emptying them.

![dnhmaw.jpg](http://oi62.tinypic.com/dnhmaw.jpg)

Using the stock-like Modular Rocket Systems Part Pack 

In the above image, I've emptied the oxidizer from the tank that supplies my nuclear engine. Is there any way I can replace the empty space with more liquid fuel? If not, are there any mods that make this possible?

If this has been brought up before I apologize, but I find it really strange that this hasn't been implemented.

This should very, very much be the case. I'm missing the B9 modpack a lot because those pieces could all be whatever you wanted them to be. The same part could be configured to be Mono, LF, LFO.. whatever you want. It was especially nice because you could build a plane and then reconfigure the tanks for whatever the mission required without totally rebuilding the plane from the ground up. Just right click the tank in the hanger and click next tank setup and you're good.

Basically infinite power, you can change anything about a part (that is in the part.cfg) mid-flight by editing persistent.sfs (Even modifying the vessel.sfs is fine); so, from a modding standpoint, we can do this again by editing the vessel directly and letting it save with changes.

I think you want [modular fuel tanks](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/64117-0-90-Modular-Fuel-Tanks-v5-4-3) (don't know how well it works in 1.0 though).

You can then change the contents of tanks to be how you want.

> 
> are there any mods that make this possible?

[Modular Fuel Tanks](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/64117-0-90-Modular-Fuel-Tanks-v5-4-3). (1.0 upgrade in progress.)

> 
> [Modular Fuel Tanks](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/64117-0-90-Modular-Fuel-Tanks-v5-4-3). (1.0 upgrade in progress.)

Looks like it just got updated today ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I still think this kind of functionality should be included as a tweakable in stock, though.
Or people could just use Mk3 parts
For the tank sizes that don't have a fuel-only alternative, you could make your own pretty easily by making a copy of the part directory and tweaking its .cfg to hold only fuel and no oxidizer.
